unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify and recall Latin grammatical structures at advanced level
assess the grammar required for the translation of Latin texts appropriate to level of study
integrate knowledge of grammar and vocabulary in reading and writing advanced Latin texts
explore and appraise relevant grammatical and lexical reference tools
recognise and memorise advanced Latin vocabulary

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students will prepare translations of unit readings for review in class. All students will be required to post their translations online before class.

enrolment_rules.description: 20cp at 2000 level including (AHIS219 or AHIS2120 or AHST208)

assessments.description: The purpose of this assessment task is to facilitate understanding of Latin grammatical structures. You will be required to translate a series of sentences from English into Latin (five sentences in each of six prose compositions). The sentences are designed to test your control over concepts discussed in the lectures and (often) illustrated in the unit readings.
The purpose of this assessment task is to test general control over unit content, through translations and grammatical analysis.

The purpose of this assessment task is to develop analytical skills and independent thinking. You will be required to provide a translation of a passage appearing in the the unit readings and give an linguistic analysis of specific grammatical features in it. Length limit: 1000 words, including analysis, any footnotes, and bibliography.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Fully online/virtual
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde
data.description: This unit aims to develop the skills of history students in order to support advanced study of the Latin language. It continues the systematic analysis of grammar from previous units and explores the concepts of historical development and diversity in the classical and medieval periods. The unit also aims to help students develop their skills in reading original Latin literary and documentary texts, and analyse the significance of Latin for the study of relevant ancient cultures.
data.title: Latin C
